result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Joseph Grutza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
- Credit of 2 days time served. 
- Huber Privileges for work, mental health, treatment.

miscConds.notes:
-Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
-Court ordered Defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- No new laws rising to the level of probable cause.

- Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, breathalyzer screening. 
- Complete a mental health assessment,my comply with any  recommended treatment. 
- Complete an anger management class.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Joseph Grutza

defendant.name: Grutza, Joshua Joseph
defendant.address: 7275 North Port Washington Road #1013, Glendale, WI 53217

records.addlTxt: Assessments for attorney fees in the amount of $550.00 entered as ordered by the court on 08-18-2022 to pay $45.00/monthly. n Final payment due by 10-02-2023.  Failure to pay is a civil judgment.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    DOUGLAS J REBHOLZ    $550.00
& Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs Due from Milwaukee County, signed and filed.

Defendant Joshua Joseph Grutza in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 2 days time served, Huber Privileges for work, mental health, treatment.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 YEAR with the following conditions:

- No new laws risings to the level of probable cause.
- -Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, breathalyzer screening.
- Complete a mental health assessment, comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain fulltime employment.
- Complete an anger management class.
- Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
- Court ordered Defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Court advised Defendant of his/her right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Joshua Joseph Grutza in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Elements of the Offense
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Defendant's Completion Certificate
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
and Offer Letter, received and filed.

Defendant Joshua Joseph Grutza in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.   Case in court for Status of counsel.  
Discussion held off the record. Defense counsel in receipt of discovery and offer in this case and request  a plea and sentencing date.
Defense instructed to file the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.Parties advised this  hearing will be held  In person, Room 623 of the Courthouse. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 05/02/22 to repay Milwaukee County $45.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing [conclusion of this case].

Defendant Joshua Joseph Grutza in court.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Doug Rebholz as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Rebholz accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $45.00 per month, commencing 30 days after the conclusion of this case, until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms and other court orders that may be imposed.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/13/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Joshua Joseph Grutza in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Joshua Joseph Grutza not in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/7/22 @ 1p
